title: Calum Scott 'wasn't paid' to sing at Sophie Turner and Joe Jonas' wedding
text:
Calum said ‘it was a really private and beautiful moment’ (Picture: FilmMagic, Reuters)

Britain’s Got Talent’s Calum Scott has claimed that he wasn’t paid to perform at Sophie Turner and Joe Jonas’ wedding in France this summer.

The 31-year-old singer, who was a finalist on the ninth series of BGT in 2015, was personally asked to perform at the wedding of the year by Jonas Brothers star Joe, who insisted the couple were big fans.

‘I met Joe at The Voice Australia,’ Calum told The Sun. ‘He was like, “Me and Sophie have been huge fans,” and I got his number and we texted.

‘Then he said, “We’ve listened to You Are The Reason all through our relationship and we were wondering if you would sing it at the wedding?”’

How cute!

Gushing about the big day, Calum, who is best known for his cover of Robyn’s Dancing On My Own, continued: ‘It was very mad, there was an embargo on all cameras, so it was a really private and beautiful moment.’

Calum rose to fame on BGT in 2015 (Picture: James Shaw/REX/Shutterstock)

However, when asked whether he had been paid for his performance, the singer curtly replied: ‘No.’

Bit awkward…

After originally secretly tying the knot in Las Vegas after the MTV Video Music Awards in May, Sophie and Joe wed for a second time surrounded by their friends and family at a chateau in France.

Sophie’s Game of Thrones co-star Maisie Williams was maid-of-honour at the ceremony, which was also attended by Ashley Graham, Priyanka Chopra and, of course, the other Jo Bros.

E! News confirmed that ‘white elegant flowers and glass candles adorned the aisles at the ceremony site’ while Sophie wore a beautiful intricate Louis Vuitton wedding dress.

Still, was there nowhere in that budget to pay Calum?

Metro.co.uk has contacted Sophie’s reps in search of comment.
description: Britain’s Got Talent’s Calum Scott has claimed that he wasn’t paid to perform at Sophie Turner and Joe Jonas’ wedding in France this summer.
